intro: Senecio amurensis, commonly known as the Amur Senecio, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia, particularly found in regions of Russia and China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, forested areas and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Senecio amurensis is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
